beats.narration: Should you race Haute Route Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Haute Route Gravel scored 56 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.

beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Haute Route Gravel. Various Europe. 350 mi. European Alpine multi-stage gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Haute Route Gravel | Various Europe | 350 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Length. 5 out of 5. Ultra distance. Bring lights and a plan. 350 miles across multiple Alpine stages delivers serious accumulated fatigue. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Mountain passes on the menu. 30,000 feet over 350 miles means serious vertical density through Alpine passes. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Remote terrain. Self-sufficiency required. Routes traverse historic Alpine passes steeped in cycling and cultural history. Experience. 4 out of 5. Special. This race sticks with you. Multi-day format through 'fields and meadows' past 'blackened barns and chalets darkened in alpine sun over centuries' following 'ancient bisses, the ingenious Swiss irrigation systems. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. High Alpine conditions create physiological demands beyond weather. Altitude. 3 out of 5. You'll feel it on the climbs. Climbs reach significant elevation through Swiss Alpine passes like Col du Grand St. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Good race quality. No major complaints. Events feature 'Full Mechanical Assistance, Full Medical Assistance, Feed Stations with local products' plus 'photographer, videographers, and drone pilots to capture the Epic-ness. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. The road Haute Route attracts riders seeking that 'pro-cyclist lifestyle taste' - serious amateurs with deep pockets and deeper delusions about their abilities.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Value. 1 out of 5. You're overpaying for the privilege of suffering. Expenses. 1 out of 5. Cheap to do. No excuses.
